attributes.action: Early Years to be open for key children & vulnerable ONLY during lockdown 2021
attributes.additional_details:
It is unfair why early years is so over looked during this whole pandemic. There is no social distancing with the children as they don’t understand. 
Early years staff have hardly got a mention, we do our job because we love it but why are we risking our lives and our families lives when the rest of the education sector is told to stay home? Makes no sense.
attributes.background: It is unfair to close down the nation yet expect early years settings to be open to all, when children aged 4 and under cannot social distance and have no or little understanding of the pandemic. This is putting many risks to children, parents and staff.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566867

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
